fields.description: As a cloud administrator, I want to use elastic IP on ELB instances so that I can manage addresses for ELB (e.g., to put in HW firewall in front of ELB).
fields.summary: Support Elastic IP on ELB Instances

comments.body:
Fix is in 4.4 branch.
To verify, set property 'euctl services.loadbalancing.worker.use_elastic_ip=true'.

Then create an ELB (either in VPC or classic) and register an instance running http server (or any). Make sure the ELB is functional (curl). 

Then allocate and associate an elastic IP with the loadbalancer VM(servo) (e.g., euca-associate-address -n eni-25eb7897 10.116.158.201). There will be up to 2 minutes of disruption to the application, but eventually curl should work again.

[~spark], do these steps work for an ELB that spans multiple availability zones?  I ask because the instructions above address applying an EIP to a single loadbalancer VM.  Thanks ahead of time for your help with this.
[~hspencer] yes it should work for multiple VMs (like multi AZ).

Story doesn't seem to work for ELBs that span multiple AZs.  Further information provided below.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.0-0.25788.147.20170202git6e5a63d.el7}}

*Assessment*

Deployed a multiple AZ ELB. When I allocated three EIPs, and replaced the EIP for each ELB instance, the curl test (attached) began to fail.  Stack created used linked {{cfn-elb-multiaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-vpc-template.json}} template.

*Setup Description*

* Eucalyptus VPC cloud with multiple AZs - [hspencer-400-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/400/]

Hi Harold- if you are good with this please move this story to in QA. I'll be doing a bulk transition to complete later when I release the 4.4.0 Version in Jira.
[~lbiasi], actually this wasn't fixed. My previous comment wasn't clear.  I will update it so that there is a better explanation.  Apologies for the confusion.

Hi [~spark] it looks like this item was not fixed in 4.4 per [~hspencer] comment above. I moved to the 5.0 Epic and changed the fix version to 4.4.1. 
Let me know if this needs to be updated differently. Thanks

[~lbiasi], the development work on this story was done for 4.4.0. This story does not belong in a 5.0 epic since it is not for 5.0. If there is a bug found during testing of a feature I think the right approach is to open an issue of type "bug" with the details.

Tested again and it works fine in VPC mode with multiple AZ.
Two things may have caused the failure in [~hspencer]'s test:
1) property should be turned on: euctl services.loadbalancing.worker.use_elastic_ip=true
2) dns ttl will keep the client seeing the updated ip until the ttl expires (60 seconds by default). Due to the internal caching, it may take up to 2 cycles of ttl expiration until the client sees the updated ip.

[~spark], this was a sweet feature implementation. Great job.  EIPs updated on ELB instances didn't even cause 503s to show up. HTTP responses during the EIP replacements were 200s.  

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.1-0.25878.35.20170413git36456cc.el7}}

*Steps*

# Deploy Eucalyptus 4.4.1 VPC cloud with multiple AZs - [hspencer-684-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/684/]
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-availability-zones
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-dollar	available
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-market	available
{code}
# Create non-eucalyptus account:
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations -w > .euca/devops-admin.ini
{code}
# Add ssh keypair:
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-keypairs --region devops-admin@
KEYPAIR	devops-admin	eb:c2:75:5d:96:eb:72:d4:4c:f7:79:e7:7c:1f:6c:ef
{code}
# Bundle, upload and register Ubuntu Xenial Cloud Image:
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-images --region devops-admin@
IMAGE	emi-53ab4ccc	ubuntu-xenial-x86_64-hvm-20170419/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml	000294836819	available	public	x86_64	machine			instance-store	hvm
{code}
# Make sure cloud property {{services.loadbalancing.worker.use_elastic_ip}} is set to {{true}}:
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euctl services.loadbalancing.worker.use_elastic_ip=true
services.loadbalancing.worker.use_elastic_ip = true
{code}
# Using linked {{cfn-elb-twoaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-instance-vpc.json}} template, deploy stack:
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euform-create-stack DevOpsNginxStack --template-file cfn-elb-twoaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-instance-vpc.json --parameter ImageId=emi-53ab4ccc --parameter KeyName=devops-admin --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.g-15-03.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --region devops-admin@
